column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I suffered from strep throat for the first time in my life as an adult.  I came home from work on Friday afternoon, and 45 minutes later I went to go lie down for a nap.  I've noticed that my throat was somewhat scratchy and began coughing some.  I didn't think anything of it.  The little coughing subsided.  Later on that night I felt worse.  I thought I just had a bad cold or something.  Saturday morning was much worse.  I had fever, chills, body aches, sore throat.  At one point, my fever climbed to 104.  On Sunday, I went to urgent care and was prescribed Keflex (Cephalexin) because I had strep throat.  I must take 3 500 mg capsules each day for 10 days.  No side effects thus far and today is Tuesday.  I thought I just had the flu.  Boy, I thought wrong! I was always told that the flu is viral and must run it's course. Otherwise, I would have gone in on Saturday.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I'm a 40 year old female, and being a sufferer of recurrent UTIs, I've been prescribed keflex on many occasions. Approx 2 hrs after taking a capsule he experienced nausea (no vomiting), confusion, distress, delirium and anxiety, lasting about 8 hours. He has had to stop the meds and is now receiving an alternative cephalosporin intravenously - with no negative side effects as far as we can tell.I guess we're all different.

column2: tissigirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Please keep in mind that ANY antibiotic, not just Keflex, can cause thrush, vaginal yeast infection, intestinal issues such as diarrhea, or a severe allergic reaction, especially in higher doses! Each person is different, and where 1 antibiotic may not effect someone it may cause a severe reaction in someone else.  All antibiotics are pretty much equal in this aspect!  Probiotics beforehand or during can help alleviate some of the issues such as yeast infections.I have been on a low dose of Keflex for several years for moderate cystic acne.  Although i'm not thrilled about having to be on an antibiotic long term, this in combination with Retin-A is the only thing that will take care of it.  I have had no side effects from it.  I have fair skin, so i'm unable to tell if it has made me more sensitive to the sun.  I agree, it does have a bad smell and taste.  But it is normally not an issue unless the pill lingers in your mouth for some reason.

column2: CRP1947, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: In 2005 I had breast cancer and surgery. In early 2008, i started having episodes that started with red hot skin on left arm, dizziness, fever, and more. It happened every 3 months, as each time it got worse and spread further. Doctors put me on Kelflex. In 2009 & 2010, landed in hospital. Diagnosis was Group G Strep. I was put on Keflex 1000mg 2x day for 2 weeks, and cut down to 2 a day, and after 30 days it was 1x per day. Was told to stay on it for 6 months. I did. When I went off, these episodes started coming back again in about 3 months. I did experience side effects of tiredness, sometimes shortness of breath, agitation, swelling of feet, etc. I don't like taking pills period, and especially antibiotics. In 2010, I had 3 episodes each 4-6 wks after the previous one.I was given Keflex for 10 days. I got tired and concerned about the recurrences so quickly, so I went to the lymphodema clinic as my concern is cancer returning. I was told, basically, that since so many nodes had been removed, I constantly run the risk of this returning, and eventually it WILL cause lymphodema. The only way to keep this gone is to take Kelflex daily. 500 mg. I am concerned about the long term effects of antibiotics. Thankfully, this has not caused female itching. BUT, I have wounds on my fingers (mostly index and thumbs) that are lesions, and sore, and bleed. I am thinking the keflex. Not sure what to do. I have tried everything doctor and over the counter. The doctor at the lympdema clinic gave me an ointment with silver in it, as he says eczema (as he diagnosed it) builds an immunity to many of the ointments used for eczema and psorasis. Well, his isn't working on my index and thumbs either. I really think it is the Keflex, and I think I am going to cut back on the keflex. Any ideas? No one seems to have an answer. My fingers really hurt. So, it seems I have a choice: sore fingers or lympodema. Hum.

column2: mbn4est, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had breast reduction surgery and was prescribed 500 mg 4x daily. Knowing that I would be under general anesthesia for 3 plus hours I built up my digestive system before surgery.  I drank liquid acidophilus and other probiotics.  The keflex was preventative in my case.  I took with it acidophilus and a small amount of food.  I had some stomach issues for 2 days but they cleared up. They did make me groggy and gave me a headache when I took my midday dose. However I was okay in the morning.  The sulphur in the drug smelled awful and I had some after taste. Anyone with 1/2 a brain in their head knows that any antiobiotic is going to have gastric side effects of some kind.  Only an idiot wouldn't have the brains to take them without a probiotic and modify their diet while they are on the course of treatment.  I was on them for a full five days.  I took the keflex as prescribed, stayed out of the sun and slept when I needed to.  There is no sign of infection and I am feeling as well as can be expected uunder the circumstances.  I hope that I never have to take them again but if they are prescribed I will not complain.  Now...ask me about Cipro and I will tell a different story.

column9: I have gotten strep throat every year for most of my life (i'm 23, in decent shape, and a petite person 5'1"). My usual doctor gives me z-pack which i have always tolerated well. I could not see him, and went to the on call doctor. She perscribed this, 500mg a day 4x a day. This medication was horrible, though it killed the strep and made my lymph node go down, around day 4 I was fine. EXCEPT, I was itchy, nauseous, had dirreaha and was developing an itchy rash around my anus and on my vuvla. Not quite a vaginal yeast infection but yeast non the less. I also had yeast sores on the sides of my mouth that were very painful. (I think part of the reason I got the rash was because I was on my period for part of the treatment and was wearing a thick pad, blocking mositure from escaping.)I stopped taking the keflex and told my dr about my symptoms. They changed me to z-pack, which i never took (I had had some 10,000mg of antibiotics by this time, a z pack is like 1250 for the whole course, I figured it was dead) They gave me diflucan? for the yeast. It did nothing but make me more nauseous and more loose stools. basically terrible. I did online research and started taking pro-biotics to replace the bacteria, eating no refined sugar, eating yogurt (plain), drinking 48oz of water a day, green tea, pomagrant juice, as well as going comando under dresses/loose sweatpants. I also used some vagisil initially, but stopped that after a few days. I also used some diluted tea tree oil, which kinda stung, but overall helped the rash. Its now day five of pro-biotics and feeling much better, rash is faded to light pink in only around my anus, and the vuvlitits is gone. (make sure to clean under your clit for yeast ladies!) Overall, the natural cure worked for me, I've had vulvitis very mildy before, as well as the sores on my mouth, but the rash was really scary. The probiotics are very easy to take, I am using "culturelle" brand. I would recommend to those needing to heal themself

column9: Dermatologist prescribed this for acne.  Took it for 5 months.  It was completely useless in terms of clearing up my skin.  Acne is not one of the listed uses for this medicine so maybe that is why it didn't work for me.  Didn't have any side effects at all.

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This medication was prescribed to my young daughter for an ear/throat related infection. The medication appeared to help the infection with a quick response time but it was at the cost of her enduring a severely upset stomache and complaints similar to that of acid reflux. Eventhough it was extremely effective, I don't think I will allow my child to be prescribed this medication again. Her stomach upset seems to be lingering eventhough she has been off the medication for a couple of days.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got this prescribed from the free clinic. I thought I had herpes. I think I have psorasis *sp. It made the red spots on my hand go away that are only relieved by hot water. Also cleared up the spots on my penis. Within 4 days they were almost completely gone. As soon as I stopped taking it,within a month the lesions reoccured. Hopefully,I get another prescription. I did have sickness while taking it,but after 3 days my body adjusted. I had some loss of appetite, minor headaches. However,making my hands stop itching,and clearing up my genitals far outweighed the nausea.
